Class Trash

  • java.lang.Object
    • Entity
      • Trash
  • All Implemented Interfaces:

    public class Trash
extends Entity
    A class representing a Trash object. Trash is a type of Entitiy.

    Zelinsky

    • Constructor Detail

      • Trash

        Trash(int x,
      int y,
      int width,
      int height,
      RequestQueue requestQueue)
        Constructs a Trash object. Calls Entity's constructor with super(x, y, width, height). Sets up the Trash's RequestQueue.
        Parameters:
        x - The x position of the Trash
        y - The y position of the Trash
        width - The width of the Trash
        height - The height of the Trash
        requestQueue - The RequestQueue of the Trash
        See Also:
        RequestQueue

    • Method Detail

      • translate

        void translate(double dx,
               double dy)
        Translates the Trash's location a distance specified by the change in x and y. Once Trash touches the bottom of the worldBounds, it will stop moving and increment the pollution level in Model. If Trash touches the top of the worldBounds, it will be removed from the game and increment the score.
        Overrides:
        translate in class Entity
        Parameters:
        dx - The distance to translate the Trash in the x direction
        dy - The distance to translate the Trash in the y direction
        See Also:
        Model

      • throwTrash

        public void throwTrash(int xSpeed,
                       int ySpeed)
        Handles how the Trash should be thrown. Sets the Trash's speed to the specified x and y speeds.
        Parameters:
        xSpeed - The speed of the Trash in the x direction
        ySpeed - The speed of the Trash in the y direction

      • thrown

        public boolean thrown()
        Returns the state of the Trash in regards to if it has been thrown with throwTrash().
        Returns:
        True if the Trash has been thrown, false otherwise
